title: Delta Seeks to Put Unruly Passengers on ‘No-Fly’ List
sub_head: CEO Ed Bastian says there should be ‘zero tolerance’ for any behavior that affects flight safety
body:
NEW YORK— Delta Air Lines has requested that the Justice Department put any person convicted of a disruption on board a flight on the national “no fly” list.
In a letter to the Justice Department Attorney General Merrick Garland dated Thursday, Delta Chief Executive Ed Bastian said there should be “zero tolerance” for any behavior that affects flight safety. Mr. Bastian noted that while such incidents of bad behavior represent a fraction of overall flights on Delta, the rate of incidents on the airline has increased nearly 100% since 2019.
